intro: Artanthe adenophylla, commonly known as the woolly artanthe, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. It thrives in arid and rocky environments, showcasing adaptations to survive in harsh, dry climates. Artanthe adenophylla is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
